intro: Govantesia malulucban, commonly known as the Malulucban fern, is a rare tropical plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Polypodiaceae and is characterized by its delicate, feather-like fronds. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments within tropical forests. Its rhizomes are often used in traditional medicine for their purported healing properties. Due to habitat loss, it is considered endangered and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
